column4: I have a question about gateways. How I have my default gateway setup to be eth0 which is directly connected, but I am also connected to a router via wireless. I was wondering how would I connect to a machine my on 192.168.2.* range without switching the gateway from eth0.
if there is a network interface on the 192.168.2 network, traffic should go there, rather than the gateway
I tried going to the router's IP address in my browser (192.168.2.1) and it just sat there loading for quite some time and still nothing happened.
and iwconfig shows you're connected to the proper wireless network?
yes, i am connected with full signal and have an ip assigned to my interface.
what does the routing table look like?  try   route   there should be a line for each interface and a line for the default gateway
i'd first try taking the wireless interface down, and bringing it back up again.
how do you normally do that?
do what? get on my router?
it is, but ill bring it down and back up just to check
i meant how do you enable your wireless connection :]
i use networking program under system
k  and after 'refreshing' the wireless connection, do you have a route for the local network 192.168.2.* ?
yes i do have route entries
